Grow more. Save more. Spend smarter. Smart, simple ways to save food, money, and the planet

",["811","812","813","814","815"],"b2ac4158-4868-4ff7-88bc-55ce72c4812a","Smart Party Tips!",["816"],["817"],"More fun, less power",["818"],["819"],"

More Fun, Less Power

\n

Hosting doesn’t have to mean higher energy bills. These simple tips will keep the vibes high and the costs low.

",["820","821","822","823","824","825"],"bd6af6e3-900a-4feb-9e38-e7607d26d1b8","Cook smarter, not harder",["816"],["826"],"Small energy savings in the kitchen can really add up. Check out how.",["827"],["819"],"

Small energy savings in the kitchen can really add up. A few changes can help reduce your energy use (and your bills).

",["828","829","830","831","832","833","834"],"052b5f63-dea2-4b14-99ef-130f29f51808","Save Energy. Get Rewards.",["816"],["835"],"Save power when it matters most. And be rewarded.",["836"],["819"],"

When energy demand peaks, the electricity grid gets stretched. A few small shifts can reduce your usage, help your community, and you could earn credits on your electricity bill with AGL’s Peak Energy Rewards.

",["837","838","839","840","841","842","843"],"ce74a407-32e1-4984-bf9a-f62ae1278fa1","10 ways to SAVE energy",["816"],["844"],"Big energy bills? These quick wins can help you save power (and money) without giving up comfort.",["845"],["819"],"

Big energy bills? These quick wins can help you save power (and money) without giving up comfort.

",["846","847","848"],"d28bf20c-183a-403b-b5e2-cf6c15b2a38e","Turn your scraps into stock",["726"],["849"],"Make a scrap-saving, packaging-free, flavour- and nutrition- boosting stock to use in soups, roasts, risottos and more.",["850"],[],"

Veggie stock, you could buy it off the shelf at the supermarket. Or, you could make it even more delicious, nutritious and economical by making it with your veggie peelings, stalks, leaves – and even bones and cheese rinds.

",["851","852","853"],"0c2ac354-045a-4a36-9146-8aac9e014235","Pantry staples",["635"],["854"],"Spice up your kitchen with these staples to start making more palate-pleasing meals more easily!",["855"],[],"

Stocking a pantry smartly will help you whip up dishes cheaper, faster, and more conveniently than ever before. And, we’re here to show you how to do it!

",["856","857","858","859","860","861","862","863","864","865","866","867","868","869","870","871","872","873","874"],"d767e0a7-e7fd-4f7b-b92e-21cde0eb90e0","Chinese-style staples",["875"],["876"],"Start building out your kitchen with these Chinese-style staples and you’ll be making not-so-standard stir-fries.",["877"],[],"

Rich, colourful and fragrant, Chinese-style dishes are packed with sweet, sour, salty and bitter elements.

",["878","879","880","881","882","883","884","885","886","887","888"],"016dd17f-3f5c-4f12-91b5-b059dce80330","Mediterranean-style staples",["875"],["889"],"Let’s get you that Mediterranean glow with these staples (hint: think generous servings of olive oil, haloumi, eggplant, fish and more).",["890"],[],"

With a focus on veggies, whole grains, seafood and good fats (like olive oils and avocado) and packed with light, bright and zesty flavours, our Mediterranean-style staples are a wonderful kitchen companion – especially for the warmer months.

",["891","892","893","894","895","896","897","898","899","900","901"],"d9bb1d45-dfb9-4e20-8285-55381742a1e8","Middle Eastern-style staples",["875"],["902"],"Bring delicate perfumes and intoxicating flavours into your kitchen with our Middle Eastern-style pantry guide.",["903"],[],"

Do you like decadent creamy flavours (like labne, hummus) interjected with bright bursts of sweet flavour (pomegranate, oh-so-perfect pomegranate!) and plenty of salt, tang and big hits of herbs? Then you’ll love our Middle Eastern-style pantry staples.

",["904","905","906","907","908","909","910","911","912","913","914","915"],"00d4c6b2-54ac-43e8-b4f3-30c86d9114f7","Japanese-style staples",["875"],["916"],"Japanese-style pantry staples feature foods that are are fermented, contain glutamates (AKA flavour-amplifying amino acids) or both. Think soy, seaweed, mushrooms, and more.",["917"],[],"

Have you ever noticed that you don’t feel the need for a sweet treat after a Japanese-inspired meal? It’s because of the well-balanced flavours in Japanese-style cooking. Unlock more satisfying meals with these staples.

Moran",["1817"],"1aec2125-5446-4cd6-b7b8-f8565ac44885","bf3934af-ab54-4af3-a2d3-a7cc876da997","Rice-portion.jpg","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Rice-portion.jpg","5105f548-017a-4c3b-805e-392b43142f1b","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/hero_images/Rice-portion.jpg","articleBlocks_textBlock_BlockType","f7fcb734-587a-49a8-a90f-e382c1b1496f","

Here’s how to measure the right amount - whether it’s basmati, brown, or jasmine - and avoid that never-ending container of leftovers.

","de93c8e9-c1a2-4590-90eb-8cfd2bf3ddbe","

How Much Rice Per Person?

\n

Dried (Uncooked) Rice:

  • 🍽 Main meal: ½ cup (90g) per adult
  • 🥗 Side dish: ⅓ cup (60g) per adult
\n

That’s about the size of a small handful per person.

","a537a524-cd6f-4928-a743-6fe02c51f2da","

Cooked Rice:

\n
  • 🍚 Main meal: 1 to 1½ cups
  • 🍚 Side dish: ¾ to 1 cup
","7447f606-2256-4061-ba19-77ea1232716a","

🍴 Quick Cook Guide:

\n
  • 2 people = 1 cup dry rice
  • 4 people = 2 cups
  • 6 people = 3 cups
","2ab35eb3-dbcd-41cd-b6fa-ce82360b31c0","Cooking-for-a-crowd.jpg","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Cooking-for-a-crowd.jpg","1b439567-ea89-4465-b861-dc8e23496b27","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/hero_images/Cooking-for-a-crowd.jpg","7701381a-8242-4d0a-8070-72082d7ef2d6","

📏 Portioning Basics

\n

That overflowing table might look impressive, but it often leads to leftovers that go uneaten. Here’s a smarter way to serve:

  • Adult: Allow about 450g total food per person (excluding dessert!)
  • Child: Around 250g total food
  • Protein: Stick to 200g protein per person total - not 200g of each meat!
  • Seafood (like prawns): 300-400g whole prawns per person is plenty
  • If you’re serving lots of sides, make smaller amounts of each. Fewer sides? Go bigger on volume.

\n

🥗 Side Dish Smarts

\n

Too many sides = too much food. Portion wisely from the start.

\n

Salad hack: Keep your dressings separate. Only dress half to start. Add more later if needed.

\n

🥔 Potato salad? Dress it early - it only gets better with time.

🧼 Smell check - Fresh fish should smell like the ocean, not like… well, fish. If it smells sour or overly “fishy,” toss it back.

\n

👀 Eyes on - Bright, clear, and slightly bulging eyes = fresh. Dull or sunken eyes = not so much.

\n

🐟 Skin deep - Look for shiny, metallic skin and firm, springy flesh. Press your finger in—if it bounces back, you’re good to go.

\n

💧 Gills & guts - If buying whole fish, peek at the gills - they should be bright red or pink, not brown or slimy.

\n

And for prawns, scallops, or squid? They should smell clean, not ammonia-like, and feel firm and slightly translucent.

\n

Fresh seafood = better flavour + better savings.

\n

So you can feel good knowing you’re cooking up a storm, not tossing your dollars overboard!

Whatever your crispy coating of choice, Saveful’s got the tips to help you nail it - every single time.

\n

From prep to pan, we’ll show you how to get that perfect crunch and avoid the dreaded soggy fish. 🔥🐠✨

","da39a16d-81d9-48cd-8c4e-b38aec414708","

Pro Tips for the Best Crispy Fish:

\n
  • Keep the batter cold - If you're in a warm climate, refrigerate between batches.
  • Use rice flour - It helps keep the coating crisp longer. If unavailable, substitute with cornstarch or potato starch.
  • Beer selection - Light beers like lagers or pale ales work best. For a non-alcoholic option, use ice-cold soda water with an extra ¼ tsp baking powder.
  • Double Fry for Large Batches: Fry fish once at 375°F (190°C) for 2½ minutes, let it drain, then re-fry at 390°F (200°C) for 1 minute to ensure ultimate crispiness.
","f1b59a75-d85c-4ec5-ac92-f6339479340b","

Light & Crispy Tempura Batter

\n

One of the best things about tempura is its versatility - you can use this batter to fry a variety of ingredients, making it a great way to experiment with whatever you have in your fridge.

\n

Best Ingredients for Tempura:

\n
  • Seafood - Prawns, fish
  • Meat - Chicken, eggs
  • Vegetables - Lotus root, kabocha squash, onions, zucchini, eggplant, mushrooms
  • Herbs - Shiso leaves
","a6c05450-077f-4c17-bc7c-a470ae47d289","

The Secret to Crispy Tempura

\n

Achieving the perfect tempura texture comes down to three key ingredients: potato starch, carbonated water, and vodka.

\n
  • Potato starch keeps the batter light and crisp. Using only flour can create a thicker crust that becomes soggy faster due to its higher gluten content.
\n
  • Carbonated water adds an airy, bubbly texture to the batter.
\n
  • Vodka helps remove excess moisture during frying, resulting in an ultra-crispy tempura coating.
","ce42f7fe-b3ad-4499-8d3a-8faea9f44e08","

How to Make the Perfect Tempura Batter

\n\n\n

Tempura batter is incredibly simple to make, but the key is to avoid overmixing.

\n

Here are some essential tips to get the crispiest results:

\n
  • Keep all ingredients as cold as possible - This prevents gluten from overdeveloping, keeping the tempura light and crispy.
\n
  • Mix the batter just before frying - This helps maintain its delicate texture.
\n
  • Use chopsticks for mixing - Avoid overworking the batter, as too much mixing activates gluten, making the tempura dense.
\n
  • Pre-coat ingredients with potato starch - Lightly dusting them before dipping into the batter helps it adhere better.
\n
  • Fry at the right temperature - Heat neutral cooking oil to 175°C (347°F) and deep-fry for 1-2 minutes until the colour turns light golden. (Since potato starch prevents deep browning, remove tempura as soon as it turns pale gold.)
\n
  • Follow these steps, and you’ll have light, crispy tempura every time!
\n

You can find the full flexible recipe in the ‘Make’ section of the app.

    • \n
  • Don’t overcrowd the pan or fryer - it lowers the temp and makes things soggy.

","2c69c0ab-7edf-4c8e-952f-67843b1197a4","

Gluten-Free Crumbing Options:

\n

These crunchy coatings work just as well - and sometimes even better - than traditional breadcrumbs:

\n

🥥 Desiccated Coconut

\n

Slightly sweet and super crispy - perfect for prawns, tofu or chicken strips.
\n👉 Pairs well with curry or chilli seasoning.

\n

🌽 Polenta / Cornmeal

\n\n

Adds a rustic, golden crunch with a mild corn flavour.
\n👉 Great for fish or vegetable fritters.

\n

🍚 Rice Crumbs / Puffed Rice Crushed

\n\n

Light and crisp with great texture.
\n👉 Use as-is or toast lightly for extra flavour.

\n

🌰 Crushed Nuts or Seeds

\n\n

Almonds, walnuts, sunflower seeds or pepitas make delicious crunchy coatings.
\n👉 Mix with a little grated cheese or herbs.

\n

🥔 Crushed Cornflakes or Potato Crisps

\n\n

For a cheat’s crunch - just check the label to make sure they’re gluten-free.
\n👉 Excellent for chicken schnitzel or crumbed fish.

\n

🍠 Gluten-Free Breadcrumbs or Panko

\n\n

Store-bought options that work exactly like the regular kind.
\n👉 Season well to boost flavour.

Shopping in season means better flavour, better value, and supporting local growers-win-win! 

\n

Here’s what’s freshest in Aussie markets this Spring:

\n

🍑 Spring Fruits to Spruce Things Up

\n
    \n
  • Strawberries - Juicy and sweet! Snack on them, blend into smoothies, or top your oats.
    • \n
  • Pineapple & papaya - Tropical and tangy - great in salsas or grilled for dessert.
    • \n
  • Citrus - Late-season oranges, mandarins, and tangelos still going strong.
    • \n
  • Loquats & mulberries - A bit more niche, but worth hunting down at farmers’ markets.
    • \n
  • Avocados - At their creamy peak! Mash, slice, spoon straight from the skin.
    • \n
\n

🥦 Fresh & Flexible Spring Veggies

\n
    \n
  • Asparagus - Quick to cook and packed with flavour-try grilled or in a risotto.
    • \n
  • Zucchini - Spiralise, grate, or roast. It’s a spring all-rounder.
    • \n
  • Green beans & peas - Sweet and snappy. Add to stir-fries, salads, or stews.
    • \n
  • Lettuce, rocket, spinach & silverbeet - Salad season is back! Keep leaves crisp and dress right before serving.
    • \n
  • Spring onions, leeks & radishes - Add brightness and bite to almost any dish.
    • \n
  • Artichokes & broad beans - More adventurous, but super seasonal and satisfying.
    • \n

Here’s what’s freshest in Aussie markets this winter:

\n

🍊 Fruit Favourites

\n
    \n
  • Citrus stars - Oranges, mandarins, lemons, limes, grapefruits, and tangelos are bursting with vitamin C and perfect for zesty snacks or salad dressings.
    • \n
  • Apples & pears - Golden Delicious, Granny Smith and Bosc pears are ideal for baking or enjoying fresh.
    • \n
  • Kiwifruit - Tangy, sweet, and packed with nutrients.
    • \n
  • Custard apples & quinces - These winter gems are made for slow-poaching and cosy desserts.
    • \n
  • Bananas - A year-round staple that’s always good for smoothies, baking or a quick snack.
    • \n
\n

🥦 Winter Veg Heroes

\n
    \n
  • Leafy greens - Spinach, silverbeet, kale and bok choy love the chill and are perfect for stir-fries and soups.
    • \n
  • Brassicas - Think broccoli, cauliflower, cabbage, and Brussels sprouts - ideal for roasting or grating into slaws.
    • \n
  • Root veg - Carrots, parsnips, potatoes, sweet potatoes, turnips and beetroot - hearty, filling and budget-friendly.
    • \n
  • Pumpkin & squash - Creamy, comforting and versatile. Great for roasting, soups and pies.
    • \n
  • Leeks & onions - Add richness to any winter recipe.
    • \n
  • Fennel & celery - Crisp, fresh flavour for soups, stews or a crunchy slaw.
    • \n

Here’s what’s at its best this season:

\n

🍎 Awesome Autumn Fruits

\n
    \n
  • Apples & pears - Crisp, sweet and perfect for lunchboxes, crumbles, and stews.
    • \n
  • Figs - Lush and jammy, figs are amazing with cheese or in baking.
    • \n
  • Pomegranates - Add a juicy burst to salads or sprinkle on savoury dishes.

🥕 Veggies Made for Autumn

\n
    \n
  • Pumpkin & squash - Comfort food central. Roast them, soup them, or bake them into something special.

    • \n
  • Carrots, beetroot & parsnips - Root veg = flavour bombs when roasted or grated into salads.

  • Cauliflower & broccoli - Super versatile. Great for gratins, stir-fries, or blitzed into soups.
    • \n
  • Cabbage & kale - Shred for slaws, sauté for sides, or add to soups and stews.
    • \n

Here’s what to pop in your basket this summer:

\n

🍑 Summer Fruits to Love

\n
    \n
  • Stone fruits - Peaches, nectarines, plums and apricots are sunshine in fruit form. Perfect for snacking, baking, or tossing into salads.
    • \n
  • Mangoes - The Aussie summer icon. Slice them, blitz them into smoothies, or grill them for a tropical twist.
    • \n
  • Berries - Strawberries, blueberries, raspberries and blackberries are at their sweetest. Freeze extras for smoothies or make jam!
    • \n
  • Melons - Watermelon, rockmelon and honeydew are hydrating and refreshing - ideal for picnics and snacks.
    • \n
  • Cherries & grapes - Great for grazing platters, lunchboxes or freezing for a frosty treat.
    • \n
  • Pineapples & lychees - Bright, tropical and perfect for desserts or zingy salsas.
    • \n
\n

🥗 Summer Veg Standouts

\n
    \n
  • Tomatoes - From cherry to heirloom, they’re ripe, sweet and perfect raw or roasted.
    • \n
  • Cucumbers & capsicums - Crunchy and cooling - great in salads or as dippers.
    • \n
  • Zucchini & eggplant - Summer BBQ must-haves. Grill, roast or spiralise.
    • \n
  • Sweetcorn - Boil, grill or cut fresh off the cob into fritters or salads.
    • \n
  • Lettuce & salad greens - Fresh, crisp and ready to layer into endless salad combos.
    • \n
  • Green beans & snow peas - Quick to cook, great in stir-fries or steamed as a side.
    • \n
","67a6ea29-e2a8-49ab-866a-862bc69116ad",["1885"],"49db2bc6-6a07-4ac4-87fd-2ff728bf2567","Shopping-seasonally.jpg","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Shopping-seasonally.jpg","0387fe47-1305-4e37-8e37-ea98dd93c5d7","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/hero_images/Shopping-seasonally.jpg","bb0fa640-6199-4512-8afd-2ac13cb1535f","

They’re not only cheaper - they’re also fresher, packed with flavour, and often grown right in your own backyard. 

\n

That means fewer food miles, better sustainability, and more money staying with Aussie producers.

\n

Here’s how to make the most of the seasons:

\n

🌱 Hit Up Your Farmers’ Market

\n

Farmers’ markets are packed with locally grown seasonal produce. Chat to the growers - they’ll tell you what’s at its peak and how best to use it.

\n

🏷 Look for “Grown Locally” Labels

\n\n

Even at the supermarket, you can still shop smart. Look for signs or stickers that show the produce is locally grown - that’s usually a good indicator it’s in season too.

\n

📍 Know What’s In Season Near You

\n

Every region is a bit different. Use a seasonal produce guide or app to find what’s growing in your area right now.

\n

🥗 Cook with the Calendar

\n

Build your meals around what’s in season. Think cucumbers and juicy tomatoes in summer, and hearty pumpkin, sweet potato and leeks in winter.

\n

❄️ Save It for Later

\n

When produce is at its peak and cheap, grab extra and preserve it! Freeze berries, pickle veg, or dry herbs - so you’ve got flavour ready to roll, all year-round.

Rubs and marinades are the ultimate way to put them to good use. With a few pantry staples and some herbs or spices you've got lying around, you can mix up your own rubs and marinades in minutes.

\n

Whip up flavour-packed combos to flavour up your meat, veg, tofu or whatever you’re cooking.
\n
\nA rub is a dry mix of herbs and spices, great for adding bold flavour before cooking - think BBQ, roasting or pan-frying.

\n

A marinade is a liquid mix (like oil, yoghurt, vinegar or citrus) that tenderises while it flavours - perfect for soaking proteins or veggies before cooking.

🔥 Oven Method:

\n
  1. Slice veg thinly (1.5mm works best).

  6. Check after 20 mins - remove any that are already crisp.
  7. Cool fully for ultimate crunch.

","fea88454-cf31-4c74-b4fd-910e9d0ea23d","https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2pix8OoGVAA","Check out Jam 3 Ways direct from the Saveful Kitchen",["1971"],"2953e995-d1c4-45f4-8b76-551025fb3337",["1972","1973","1974"],"e7e99db5-1bb2-437e-b986-f6474357e9a5","

🍓 Jam Tips:

\n

Know When It’s Set

\n

No thermometer? No worries! Here are two easy ways to check if your jam has reached the magic setting point (around 105°C):

\n

\n

🥶 Plate Test

\n

Pop a small plate in the freezer for 15 mins. Once your jam’s been bubbling away, spoon a little onto the cold plate and let it sit for a few seconds. Push your finger through it — if it wrinkles, your jam is good to go! No wrinkles? Simmer a few minutes more and test again.

\n

\n

🥄 Spoon Test

\n

Chill a spoon in the fridge. Scoop up some hot jam, then tilt the spoon. If the jam flows off in a thick sheet (not watery), it’s ready!

\n

\n

Other signs you’re close to jam perfection:

\n
  • The bubbling slows and feels more relaxed
  • Air bubbles disappear
  • The surface looks glossy
  • The texture thickens

We’re all about helping you make the most of every roll, slice, and crust. Whether it’s fresh or a few days old, we’ve got smart tips for storing it right, bringing it back to life, and turning those extra bits into something seriously delicious.

","01cc949c-af4a-4e26-a84a-0554a39fc2c1","

Freeze it (Yes, really!)

\n

Bread freezes beautifully.

\n
    \n
  • Slice it first so you can grab just what you need.
    • \n
  • Wrap in a beeswax wrap or snap-lock bag, then store in the freezer for up to 3 months.
    • \n
  • Toast straight from frozen - no defrosting needed!
    • \n
","48e4ff5c-3de8-491a-b3c9-57a52de1f7c9","

Bread box vs Fridge

\n

Avoid the fridge - it dries bread out faster.

\n

Store your bread in a cool, dark spot in a paper bag, cloth bag, or bread box to keep it soft and fresh.

","f94a9be4-5c08-4ad0-a80b-1684ea9ec32c","

Roll it right

\n

Wrap crusty breads in a clean tea towel to keep the crust crisp and the inside soft.

\n

For soft loaves, use reusable zip bags, beeswax wraps, or the original packaging to keep them from drying out.

","af03c037-82d0-43df-8edf-4f3a8a3c2834","

Save the crusts

\n

Use them for:

\n
    \n
  • Homemade croutons
    • \n
  • Breadcrumbs
    • \n
  • Bread & butter pudding
    • \n
  • Toasted toppers for soups and salads
    • \n
","00f0dbec-433a-4faf-a183-53c0263ee289","

Refresh old bread

\n

Sprinkle lightly with water, wrap in foil, and pop in a warm oven (160°C) for 5–10 mins to bring it back to life.

","f62834c7-a9b1-42af-8a43-d831bdb1da42","8d9ec94d-025f-4431-b6c6-a3e951cdcefb","Smart-Party-Tips.jpg","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Smart-Party-Tips.jpg","0b1c9c94-08ac-47e5-99e4-f30ba465b427","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/hero_images/Smart-Party-Tips.jpg","01f482b5-76ea-4a14-9389-f70bf1aa1e7d","AGL",["1992"],["1993"],"AGL Energy","022709bd-b174-464a-acee-94ebbfd304f3","

☀️Keep your cool – efficiently

\n

Pre-cool your home
\nCool things down in the morning with open windows or fans before guests arrive - it's more energy-efficient than blasting the AC later.

\n

Use fans instead of AC
\nCeiling fans can cost around 20x less to run than split system air con. Fresh air + fans = cool comfort.

","3828f57d-bdbe-4617-ade6-5ce760b7d975","

🌿 Host it outdoors

\n

Take the party outside
\nSkip the air con and set up outside with shade sails, greenery or umbrellas.

\n

Light it up with solar
\nSolar fairy lights or lanterns charge all day and glow all night - no plugs, no fuss.

\n

Switch to LEDs
\nIf you're plugging in, make it LED - they use 75% less energy than halogen bulbs.

\n

Keep doors closed
\nCelebrating inside and out? Keep doors shut so your heating or cooling doesn’t drift away.

","aa238822-519b-4426-927b-129225ced075","

🍹 Chill without the fridge

\n

Ditch the spare fridge
\nExtra fridges = extra power. Use an esky with ice instead - easy for guests and easy on your energy use.

","165b38a7-1da6-4fa2-a558-f13c0b5a5efa","

🍽️ Cook the easy way

\n

Skip the oven
\nOvens chew through energy. Use a slow cooker, microwave or toaster oven for party snacks.

","b16314be-8f83-4426-aa48-ea7cdbb4cff7",["1994"],"7b42e0ad-0963-4bf0-b7b4-acc8920bf487","

Small changes, big party energy – without the big power bill.

\n


\nWant to know where your energy’s going?

\n

","ddd3df7d-42af-4583-9aa5-09a294ab4d43","Cook-Smarter-Not-Harder.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Cook-Smarter-Not-Harder.png","e2a388e6-f323-47e7-8909-0690cdde2fe2","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/hero_images/Cook-Smarter-Not-Harder.png","ada7795e-84a5-4c99-842f-8a0ddf88f1ad","

Choose the right tools

\n

Use smaller appliances when you can
\nMaking a toastie? A sandwich press can use way less power than a grill.

\n

Slow cook for the win
\nSlow cookers use low heat over a long time - and they’re great for flavour-packed, energy-efficient meals.

\n

Air fryers = fast + efficient
\nThey cook quicker than traditional ovens and use less energy - perfect for quick snacks or dinners.

\n

Microwaves beat ovens for small meals
\nNo preheating needed, and less energy is used. Just unplug it when not in use to avoid wasting standby power.

","0149b69e-f523-4887-9d35-0418c056f545","

Make your stovetop work harder

\n

Use the right pan size + lids
\nMatch your pot size to the burner, use lids to trap heat, and simmer instead of boiling like crazy.

\n

Try induction
\nIf you’re upgrading, induction cooktops are more efficient than gas - they heat the pot directly, not the surface.

","15cac392-0b3a-434b-917e-b8de908d727d","

Oven hacks to save energy

\n

Batch cook
\nIf the oven’s on, cook multiple meals at once. Batch cooking saves time, energy, and effort later in the week.

\n

Keep the door shut
\nOpening the oven door drops the temp - and uses more energy to recover. Be patient and peek less.

\n

Turn it off early
\nSwitch off the oven 10–15 minutes before time’s up. The residual heat will finish the job.

","cc665c8a-61b5-407c-87e2-ec3d5946ae2c","

Save energy when cleaning up

\n

Only run full dishwasher loads
\nUse eco mode and run it at night to avoid peak times.

","c2e0539e-442e-4784-8f06-5c153ae394a6","

Prep smart to save more

\n

Defrost ahead of time
\nCooking from frozen takes longer and uses more energy - thaw in the fridge the night before.

\n

Chop smaller pieces
\nThey cook faster and use less heat. Easy win!

\n

Cook once, eat twice
\nMake double portions and freeze half - it’s cheaper and quicker to reheat later.

\n

Try raw meals now and then
No cooking, no energy used - and still delicious. Think salads, wraps or protein balls.

","d86870ef-2d15-4615-8ca8-f1568147bf4e",["1995"],"aabe6d02-0372-42b9-8d2f-6522fe4c84e7","

Check out more AGL Tips for using less energy.

\n

","a0487a43-a7f0-4d68-bca0-b5d0ec3384c6","Save-Energy.-Get-Rewards.-It’s-a-Win-Win.jpg","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Save-Energy.-Get-Rewards.-It%E2%80%99s-a-Win-Win.jpg","35177fbf-b408-4bae-936d-5a92e83b9ccc","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/hero_images/Save-Energy.-Get-Rewards.-It%E2%80%99s-a-Win-Win.jpg","e4972349-9c00-451f-b524-ebc0af471d63","

1. Stay cool the clever way

\n

In summer pre-cool your home before the event starts.

\n

Switch off the AC during peak time and use fans (they use a fraction of the energy!)

\n

Set your thermostat between 24-26°C if the AC has to stay on.

\n

Use Eco mode on your aircon and keep doors closed to trap the cool air.

","b28c672a-0510-4f0e-b36a-cf7dbeb5b3db","

2. Heat less, save more

\n

In winter rug up instead of cranking the heater - every degree over 20°C can add up to 10% to your heating bill.

\n

Only heat the rooms you’re using.

\n

Use efficient appliances where possible

","e7fef92d-6eef-48e2-ad8b-c84c5dd927c2","

3. Pause the chores

\n

Delay using the dishwasher, washing machine, vacuum or oven until after the event.

\n

If you’re on time-of-use pricing, you’ll save even more by shifting these to off-peak hours.

","ccbbd1d0-75be-4e04-be1d-bac3f12573c8","

4. Switch off standby power

\n

TVs, consoles, chargers and more all drain energy in standby mode. Turn them off at the wall.

\n

Smart powerboards are a handy upgrade - they cut power automatically when devices aren’t in use.

","fe2c26bb-42b2-49db-9b44-f5ca95dd996c","

5. Head outside

\n

Take a walk, visit the park, or just relax in your backyard. Less time indoors = less appliances used.

\n

Avoid using electric garden tools during peak periods - do some hand weeding instead!

","8de19099-00f9-469c-94f1-a37a6dcd6fe8",["1996"],"bdf67a41-7fd9-404e-8031-555b07a386cb","

You don’t have to give up comfort to do your bit.
\nTo be eligible for AGL’s Peak Energy Rewards Program, you must have an active residential AGL electricity plan and a remotely read digital smart meter. Find out more AGL Peak Energy Rewards.

\n

Terms, conditions & eligibility applies.

\n

","da60dd1a-82b9-450a-aade-c2208a1e5ae5","10-Easy-Ways-to-Save-Energy-at-Home.jpg","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/10-Easy-Ways-to-Save-Energy-at-Home.jpg","39265052-0d48-4ce3-be9a-acbb79a70bb7","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/hero_images/10-Easy-Ways-to-Save-Energy-at-Home.jpg","d7e62481-b4d7-437c-9617-d7b093da7079","

1. Cook smart
\nDefrost overnight in the fridge (not the microwave), use lids on pots, and check oven seals to keep heat in.

\n

2. Unplug unused devices
\nChargers, lamps, and kitchen gadgets on standby still use power. A powerboard makes it easy to switch off in one go.

\n

3. Choose local when you can
\nBuying locally grown food and products made closer to home often means less hidden energy used in transport and production.

\n

4. Machine wash in cold water
\nMost clothes come out just as clean on a cold cycle – and you’ll cut down energy use.

\n

5. Ditch the dryer when you can
\nSunshine and a clothes horse = free drying! If you use a dryer, don’t overload for air to circulate.

\n

6. Swap to LED globes
\nThey use way less energy and last much longer. Bonus tip: only light the room you’re in!

\n

7. Switch your showerhead
\nWater-efficient showerheads = less hot water = lower bills. Easy win.

\n

8. Stop sneaky draughts
\nSeal gaps around windows and doors to keep cool air inside in summer and warm air in winter.

\n

9. Plant for the seasons
\nDeciduous trees and shrubs surrounding your house can cool your house in summer and let sunlight through in winter.

\n

10. Get smart tech
\nSmart plugs, lights, and thermostats let you control things remotely - great if you forget to switch off.

","0150fb7b-9ff4-465e-8bea-15fbaac92c60",["1997"],"826e1342-f1ad-43f2-9bcc-1f3fc9735985","

Want personalised tips for your home?
\n
\nCheck out AGL’s free interactive Energy Coach tool to find ways to save based on how you live.

\n

","b18861fd-1144-4692-a123-a810685b2609","Stocks-header.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Stocks-header.png","d050c946-3b65-44ed-befb-08dd07d94525","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/hero_images/Stocks-header.png","3aa16699-8723-4998-9c6c-15508746b217","

Want to start throwing out even less scraps? This stock hack will help! Not only are homemade stocks the epitome of circular cooking, they’re also perfect for people on a low-salt diet. Why? Because the flavour is coming from the aromatic veggies and umami – not just salt. Ready to take stock? Let’s go.

","6c1ab55d-e414-4d50-8afc-02e1df8e7325","http://assets.saveful.com/Hack-Stocks.mp4","Turning your veggie scraps into a superb stock is simpler than you think.",["1998"],"24485ba8-6746-4e22-a511-75525d16d7f2","TOP 5 SAVEFUL STOCK TIPS",["1999","2000","2001","2002","2003"],"b5da54a7-de94-480b-a324-9fd428c11a63","Pantry-Staples-header.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Pantry-Staples-header.png","65a6d0ef-1d5d-4243-8697-3d77fd8b33c0","

Here are chef’s tips on the ingredients that last and level-up almost any dish – organised in the way chefs compose meals: by 'components'. Why do chefs cook with components? Because it's a method that focuses on elements over ingredients. And that means you have more flexibility to swap ingredients in and out with ease. 

So, check out what’s already in your kitchen and then make a note to top up your pantry with some of these staples so you can unlock even more meals at home! (Hint: remember to check in on your pantry at least once a week so you never run out of a saving-grace staple!)

","e206889f-b79e-42b2-9e8f-e18d77319bec","https://assets.saveful.com/Hack-Pantry.mp4","Check out the Saveful guide to pantry must-haves (plus a bonus fridge staple!)",["2004"],"articleBlocks_imageDetailsBlock_BlockType","894d2457-5f67-4ade-98f9-c733cdc63fa0",["2005"],"Salt","Salty elements elevate the flavour of pretty much everything – adding a pinch of salt even helps bring out sweet flavours in baking!","338ac5f9-51cb-4c80-916f-7791f4549854","

Salt
We like a good sea salt for its versatility, but any kind will do.

Soy sauce 
It’s just such an all-rounder! Add it to stir-fries, fried rice, salad dressings, soups, marinades and more.

","7a4c6c7b-9705-4e4d-bee2-e03b71651b14",["2006"],"Acid","Acid helps balance and enhance other flavours and adds bright, fresh notes to your food.","f7f351fe-94e8-486d-83dd-cb43564f0382","

Lemon
A good squeeze of lemon juice or a sprinkle of zest will lift salads to seafood, pancakes to curries and everything in between.

Vinegar
Having one good vinegar in your kitchen will add more complexity to your dishes. We like an all-purpose red wine vinegar, but most of them do the trick (stronger flavoured ones like balsamic are better suited as extras, not staples). Add tang to salads, marinades and even soups.

Canned tomatoes 
The humble canned tomato is not to be overlooked – it’s another essential acidic element with a whole lot of flavour-boosting love to give! Use it in bolognaise, Go-to Mexican inspired chilli, tomato-y pasta, lasagne, pizza sauce and so much more.

","1941f220-1ddc-4d28-a025-853e97ef112c",["2007"],"Fat","Fat helps bring out flavour (and makes you feel full!)","9e6f0185-a5b2-44f3-a11e-3acc73f1f15c","

Neutral oil
A neutral oil won’t overpower lighter or Asian flavours and can be used for baking, too. Choose from canola, sunflower, veggie, or peanut oil.

Extra-virgin olive oil 
Our go-to for whenever you want more flavour from your salads! Equally great for making an oil-based pasta dish (or simply drizzled over pasta). 

","bd0e08fd-07fb-4cf3-9c3d-18ffdb492837",["2008"],"ccdf6cdb-0172-43f7-9a80-739ef656585e","

Coconut milk
Beautifully rich and aromatic, coconut milk is a great substitute for dairy cream, and adds a nutty, creamy and subtly-sweet flavour to both savoury and sweet dishes. Use it in curries, soups (we love it in pumpkin soup!) and even sago pudding with some in-season mangoes for summertime treats.

Mayonnaise
Great for wraps, burgers, and even making your own burger sauce with. We love a combo of Praise mayonnaise, ketchup, a splash of pickle juice and a pinch of paprika or cayenne, combined to taste. Heaven!

","4b2f107b-19b3-4bf6-87ac-8bbbb621843b",["2009"],"Aromatics","Aromatics add aroma and flavour to every dish","99528ac8-a477-41bc-874f-419df41dfca7","

Onion & garlic
If you can eat them, onion and garlic make every dish taste better! They also have a bunch of health benefits – like helping reduce cholesterol and blood pressure.

","a2f7da35-629b-4346-b312-f114345188f9",["2010"],"Carbs","Having some rice, grains, noodles and pasta at the ready helps turn leftover veggies into hearty dishes!","fbfd1edc-d929-4b4d-9234-83d5a789c3f8","

Rice
Rice makes everything twice as nice in our books – great for risotto, stir-fries, fried rice, and to serve with curries. Plus, it can even be added to soups.

Pasta
Who doesn’t love a comforting bowl of pasta (or a light and easy pasta salad in the summer)? Creamy, tomato-y, or olive oil sauces – they’re all molto bene in our opinion!

2-minute noodles 
Keeping a couple of packets of Maggi 2-minute noodles on hand makes it even easier to whip up a stir-fry or make Okonomiyaki (Japanese pancake).

","b8c120d0-00a3-42ad-a9c9-bb2eb5b4a7d8",["2011"],"Umami","Want to pack in even more savoury flavour? Add these umami flavour bombs to your kitchen kit!","6f7aa7f8-2596-4bd2-9066-f67e8f6bc0e1","

Miso paste
Miso packs a hefty umami punch. You can add it to almost anything for extra depth of flavour. Use in glazes and marinades, roasted veg, soups, and more. It's especially delicious as a glaze on roasted pumpkin!

Tomato paste
Oh-so-handy to have on hand (for similar reasons to miso)!

","f2dbb244-8360-466a-a650-6184689c962c",["2012"],"Bonus item","If you eat dairy, make this item a permanent fixture in your fridge!","69140bbf-7224-40c9-aa0e-f583368587e3","

Parmesan
Parmesan keeps for ages in the fridge and can level-up dressings, pastas, salads, risotto, pizza, soups, and more.

","21014fb3-33af-42f6-99a2-5630661c92bb",["2013"],"34f10ecb-8aa0-4f61-b5cd-78b5ab0d8c5f","f5157097-053c-4012-9201-fadef4c6b6b9","Chinese-header-image_2023-12-19-033405_nuhh.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Chinese-header-image_2023-12-19-033405_nuhh.png","3cf0910d-8212-47cb-9c9f-b56fb806d828","

Like Chinese-style flavours and dishes? Step up your stir-fries, make your noodle soups next level, and add a hint of Chinese-style flavour to Saveful frameworks with these staples.

But Mediterranean-style cooking doesn’t stop when summer ends, hearty soups and tomato-y flavours will provide warming nourishment as the temperature cools. Here’s our swear-by list of Mediterranean-style staples to help you add your favourite flavours to many a Saveful meal.

The lighter side of Middle Eastern-style cooking (think grain bowls and grills) is perfectly suited to outdoor entertaining. While heavier, long-simmered dishes are wonderful winter warmers. Let this simple Middle Eastern-style kitchen kit take you to another world and unlock a multitude of Middle Eastern-inspired Saveful dishes – for any season.

","53aec493-33de-4602-92ef-8b8eece8491e",["2014"],"Olive oil, extra virgin olive oil","2113d97c-76ae-44c7-b577-e6a24aad355a",["2015"],"Lemon, orange, preserved lemon, white vinegar, red wine vinegar","0e3932df-e668-497a-b272-a6e7124e4448",["2016"],"Canned or dried chickpeas, beans and lentils, canned tomatoes, tahini, sesame seeds, pomegranate molasses, yoghurt (or labne), feta, hummus","0b39e018-07af-4c1f-8191-ab002f13fceb",["2017"],"Onion, garlic, chilli, ginger","ed29baf9-2c10-4e8f-a5ff-2167f4949f3e",["2018"],"Mint, parsley, coriander, thyme, bay leaves","5fc9b67b-c6ab-49b8-9a4c-8612959de6c3",["2019"],"Cumin, coriander, paprika - sweet and smoked, sumac, dukkah, harissa, turmeric, saffron, za’atar, baharat, ground chilli, chilli flakes, cinnamon","6fd2f67c-fc03-4c9d-bc21-ab7fa0e94905",["2025"],"c0e12b3f-7d8a-419b-b078-c0ae5730ff98",["2010"],"Lentils, rice, burghul, freekeh, quinoa, cous cous, flatbread","1b8ebcbe-d877-4a43-a3b8-c891defe75bf",["2021"],"Lemons, capsicum, eggplant, radish, pumpkin, carrot, cauliflower, sweet potato, tomato, zucchini, squash, beetroot, turnips, cabbage, spinach, chard, kale, celery, rocket, lettuce, cucumber, okra","dd22871c-0b04-4f1e-8410-302ce68b9b33",["2026"],"f01319af-5255-4a3f-bdb6-a6f2847276ce",["2023"],"Chickpeas, lamb, goat, chicken, seafood","78f2d0c5-ef5a-4de4-9010-181c1d7bc6e1","Japanese-header-image_2023-12-19-035119_nytk.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Japanese-header-image_2023-12-19-035119_nytk.png","7e9b6670-6318-4c51-a494-d38af571df1b","

In Japanese cooking, there’s a concept known as the “rule of five”. The goal is to create harmonious dishes by appealing to the five senses, using five elemental colours (white, black, green, red and yellow), five preparations (fried, steamed, simmered, grilled, and raw), and the five tastes (Japan adds ‘umami’ to round out sweet, salty, sour and bitter). Bring harmonious and comforting flavours and feelings into your kitchen with our Japanese-style kitchen kit.

Long Pasta (Spaghetti, Linguine, Fettuccine, Angel Hair, Bucatini)","

60-75g dry pasta per person = 1 cup cooked

\n

Long noodles can be tricky to measure, but here’s the hack:

\n

👉 Grab a bunch about the size of a 20 cent coin per person - that’s your perfect single portion.

",[],"3eacc8e5-e0e0-49cb-ad9e-b6afd17b88fb","🍴 Penne","

70g dry pasta per person = 1 cup dry = 1 ½ - 2 cups of cooked pasta

\n

This fan favourite puffs up nicely. Use 1 cup of dry penne per person to get the perfect serve.

",[],"d3aa76c2-2ef6-4b21-a272-4591645bbdd0","🌀 Fusilli, Orzo, Medium Shells, Macaroni","

70g dry = 1 cup dry = 1 ½ - 2 cup cooked

\n

Shorter pasta shapes take up less space dry, but they still expand plenty when cooked.

",[],"b1d36708-8632-4cdd-b715-975f05673906","How-much-pasta-is-enough_2025-06-28-014230_ytah.jpg","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/How-much-pasta-is-enough_2025-06-28-014230_ytah.jpg","listItems_BlockType","ef865f79-5b4f-45cf-9ec1-49b63977848f","

🧶 Flaxseed Meal

\n


Nutty, earthy, and packed with omega-3s.

\n\n


🔁 Swap 1 egg for: 1 tbsp ground flaxseed + 2–3 tbsp water

\n


✅ Best for: Cookies, muffins, quick breads

\n


📝 Tip: Mix and let sit for 5 mins to gel = “flax egg”

","5104976e-e5d7-4a44-be6a-6bab7c6021b9","

🌱 Chia Seeds

\n


Mild in flavour, mighty in binding.

\n


🔁 Swap 1 egg for: 1 tbsp chia seeds + 2-3 tbsp water

\n


✅ Best for: Waffles, muffins, quick breads

\n


📝 Tip: Great if you like a bit of texture!

","e5e75a32-ffdf-4ece-bf23-4c6950447492","

🍌 Mashed Banana

\n


Sweet, chewy and deliciously moist.

\n


🔁 Swap 1 egg for: ¼ cup mashed banana

\n


✅ Best for: Brownies, blondies, pancakes

\n


📝 Tip: Brings banana flavour - match it to your bake.

","f33e53b4-97e3-48a5-82b8-326c8ca9e5aa","

🍎 Applesauce / Pumpkin / Sweet Potato

\n


Smooth and subtle with moisture magic.

\n


🔁 Swap 1 egg for: ¼ cup of purée

\n


✅ Best for: Cakes, muffins, brownies

\n\n


📝 Tip: Add a pinch of baking powder for fluffier results.

","3aac3222-cb2f-49b1-85f7-75002d4852f5","

🍮 Silken Tofu

\n


Creamy, neutral, and ultra-reliable.

\n


🔁 Swap 1 egg for: ¼ cup blended silken tofu

\n


✅ Best for: Rich cakes, brownies, dense loaves

\n


📝 Tip: Blend until silky for best texture.

","c74f1a39-ee37-4434-b77e-1143af2f19d0","

🥫 Aquafaba

\n


The the liquid from a can of chickpeas.

\n


🔁 Swap 1 egg for: 3 tbsp aquafaba

\n


✅ Best for: Meringues, mayo, cakes, muffins

\n


📝 Tip: Whip it like egg whites or stir it straight in.

","65fce75f-4f2f-4d03-9f9e-255b1073c39e","

🌽 Starches

\n


Binding and thickening heroes.

\n


🔁 Swap 1 egg for: 2 tbsp cornstarch/arrowroot/tapioca + 3 tbsp water OR 1 tbsp agar + 1 tbsp water (for a mock egg white)

\n


✅ Best for: Custards, sauces, cookies, cakes

","51c40c84-4a87-43ad-9480-66d45d37434a","

🥛 Plain Yoghurt or Buttermilk

\n


Tangy and tender with a creamy finish.

\n


🔁 Swap 1 egg for: ¼ cup yoghurt or buttermilk

\n


✅ Best for: Cakes, cupcakes, muffins

\n


📝 Tip: Adds moisture without much flavour shift.

","2e48400a-c9f2-4afa-a6f2-4445957d084e","

🍰 Mayonnaise

\n


The OG hack - moisture + richness in one.

\n


🔁 Swap 1 egg for: 3 tbsp mayonnaise

\n


✅ Best for: Chocolate cakes, spice cakes, brownies

\n


📝 Tip: Great for boxed cake mixes too.

","999e04b1-3b52-4384-88f2-a8839ea75333","Cakes","\n \n \n \n

Flax, banana, applesauce, aquafaba, yoghurt, mayo

",[],"e2ddbc16-4ba2-4037-847e-c60fa1d7cf46","🍤 Traditional Prawn Cocktail Sauce","

That retro seafood classic - made better (and cheaper) at home.

\n

You’ll need:

  • ⅔ cup tomato sauce (ketchup)
  • 1 tbsp mayonnaise
  • ¼ tsp each: mustard powder, onion powder, garlic powder, white sugar (or swap for 1 tsp Dijon mustard)
  • ¼ tsp Tabasco sauce
  • 1 tsp fresh lemon juice
  • 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce
  • Salt and pepper to taste
\n

Mix it all together and chill before serving. Great with prawns, cold seafood, or spooned over iceberg lettuce wedges.

",[],"62cb0130-5345-460b-8bfb-9afbd9ab7b3f","🐟 Tartare Sauce (Perfect for Fish & Chips)","

Creamy, tangy, and made with just a few things in the fridge.

\n

You’ll need:

  • 1 cup mayonnaise
  • 1 tbsp pickles or gherkins, finely chopped
  • 1½ tsp fresh dill or 1 tsp dried
  • 1 tsp parsley (fresh or ½ tsp dried)
  • 1 tsp capers, chopped
  • 1½ tbsp lemon juice or pickle juice
  • ½ tsp white sugar (optional — skip if using sweet mayo)
  • ¼ tsp salt
\n

Stir, chill, dollop. Delicious on fish, chips, burgers or veggie fritters.

",[],"ccbdfae7-9f43-490c-8378-a1f5aca66f3e","💃 Salsa Rose / Thousand Island","

Creamy, tangy, and a little fancy. Great with prawns, burgers, or salads.

\n

You’ll need:

  • ⅔ cup mayonnaise
  • 1 tbsp tomato sauce (ketchup)
  • 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce
  • 1½ tsp horseradish cream (optional)
  • ¼ tsp Tabasco
  • Pinch of cayenne pepper (optional)
\n

Mix and taste - adjust heat to your liking!

",[],"27b443f7-b6e2-4039-a273-d5a8106e4518","🌶️ Thai Lime & Sweet Chilli Dressing","

Zingy, herby, and brilliant with grilled prawns, rice salads or BBQ chicken.

\n

You’ll need:

  • 5 tbsp sweet chilli sauce
  • ⅔ cup lime juice
  • 5 tbsp oil (olive, peanut, canola or veg)
  • 1 garlic clove, minced
  • ¼ cup chopped coriander (optional)
  • 1 red chilli, finely sliced (optional)
\n

Whisk together and serve fresh or store in the fridge for up to 1 week.

",[],"358d2554-a795-410c-a549-9afbc0df1fe0","Saveful-Seafood-dipping-sauces-landscape-small_2025-06-28-002939_wlyl.jpg","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Saveful-Seafood-dipping-sauces-landscape-small_2025-06-28-002939_wlyl.jpg","0af00719-79db-4307-a758-c2273d278459","Saveful-Fish-prep-hack-landscape-small_2025-06-28-001359_jndm.jpg","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Saveful-Fish-prep-hack-landscape-small_2025-06-28-001359_jndm.jpg","9a80580a-d03c-43f9-9e98-7fe7c80be441","

🧂 Prep Your Ingredient

\n

Pat your protein or veg dry with paper towel - moisture is the enemy of crispiness.
\nLightly season with salt and pepper before crumbing.

","ece56dc0-23d1-4045-acf2-37a47fcae0e5","

🍳 Set Up Your Crumbing Station

\n

Line up three shallow bowls:

\n
    \n
  • Flour: Add a pinch of salt, paprika, garlic or onion powder for extra flavour.
    • \n
  • Egg wash: Beat eggs
    • \n
  • Breadcrumbs: Use regular or panko. Add grated Parmesan, herbs, or spices for extra punch.
    • \n
","dd534313-85e6-4600-9d02-1e7aafc8c5ae","

🖐 The Crumbing Process

\n
    \n
  1. Flour - Lightly coat and shake off excess
    2. \n
  2. Egg wash - Dip and coat completely
    3. \n
  3. Breadcrumbs - Press firmly so it sticks evenly
    4. \n
\n

✨ For extra crunch, double dip: egg wash → breadcrumbs again.

","1c77e28c-80c9-414c-98a5-b1d0b31bd74f","

🔥 Cook Your Crumbed Creation

\n

Pan-fry: Heat ½ inch of oil in a pan to 180°C (350°F).
\nFry for 2–3 mins per side, or until golden and crispy.
\nDrain on a cooling rack or paper towels.

\n

Oven-bake: Cook at 200°C (400°F) for 15–20 mins, flipping halfway.

\n

Air fry: Spray lightly with oil and cook at 200°C (400°F) for 10 - 12 mins.

","hackOrTip_default_Entry","71d9f4a7-bdb2-4efe-a3cc-a3ccad2ed60e","ee82975d-7b59-406c-a90c-245d4825e4ad","

🥣 Tempura Batter Recipe

\n

You’ll need:

\n
    \n
  • ¾ cup plain flour
    • \n
  • ½ cup potato starch (divided)
    • \n
  • 1 large egg
    • \n
  • ¼ cup vodka (chilled in the freezer)
    • \n
  • ¾ cup carbonated water (chilled in the fridge)
    • \n
","d1667665-91b7-43fe-94e3-589e76c78454","

🧊 Make the Batter (Keep it Cold!)

\n
    \n
  1. In a bowl, mix flour with ¼ cup potato starch.
    2. \n
  2. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg, then stir in cold vodka and carbonated water.
    3. \n
  3. Gently combine the wet and dry ingredients using chopsticks or a fork. Don’t overmix - a few lumps = light, crispy texture.
    4. \n
\n

🕒 Mix fast - under 1 minute is ideal!

","61ea87fa-abcf-4877-be70-8ee761f00a6b","

🧂 Pre-Coat for Crispness

\n
    \n
  • Place the remaining ¼ cup of potato starch in a shallow bowl.
    • \n
  • Lightly dust prawns and veggies before dipping into the batter - it helps the coating stick better.
    • \n
","9dc0da1e-2694-43d4-b79d-9d8f80c88234","🍤 How to Fry Seafood","
    \n
  1. Hold by the tail, dip into batter, coat evenly.
    2. \n
  2. Lower gently into hot oil (175°C / 347°F).
    3. \n
  3. For extra-crispy bits, drizzle a few drops of batter on top as it fries.
    4. \n
  4. Cook for 1-2 minutes, turning once.
    5. \n
  5. Remove when light golden and rest on a cooling rack.
    6. \n
",[],"5138d21b-d6ff-453e-ad57-86b4b45ca216","🥕 How to Fry Vegetables","
    \n
  1. Dip and gently lower into oil.
    2. \n
  2. Root veg (e.g. sweet potato, kabocha): ~3 minutes
    3. \n
  3. Soft veg (e.g. zucchini, mushrooms): 1-2 minutes
    4. \n
  4. Turn occasionally and remove once light golden. Tempura should be crisp and pale - not dark brown.
    5. \n
",[],"e2488540-6abb-4b31-a233-3abea4908f3c","Sun Rice Transparent Logo","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/sponsor_logos/SunRice-Transparent-Logo.png","041b8d84-d86f-4166-9940-6d97ddd26b4a","Sun Rice BW","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/sponsor_logos/SunRice-BW.png","5c9e9e0d-c647-45d0-a3af-993f197a2cc1","🍽️ The Absorption Method (Stovetop)","

The classic way to cook rice with no draining required.

\n
  1. Rinse the rice until the water runs clear - this removes excess starch.
  2. Add to a saucepan with a tight-fitting lid.
    • White rice: 1 cup rice : 1½ cups water
    • Brown rice: 1 cup rice : 2 cups water
  3. Bring to a boil (uncovered), then cover and reduce to low.
  4. Simmer gently (don’t lift the lid!).
    • White rice: 12-15 mins
    • Brown rice: 30-35 mins
  5. Rest for 5-10 mins, then fluff with a fork.
\n

Pro Tip: No peeking while it cooks - steam does the magic!

",[],"276c1a89-3414-4b18-8e11-cb292b52496d","💦 Rapid Boil Method (Then Drain)","

Great for brown rice or when you're short on time.

\n
    \n
  1. Boil a large pot of water (like pasta).
    2. \n
  2. Add rinsed rice.
    3. \n
  3. Boil until tender:
      \n
    • White rice: 10-12 mins
      • \n
    • Brown rice: 25-30 mins
      • \n
    4. \n \n
  4. Drain and let sit for 5 mins with a tea towel over the pot to absorb extra moisture.
    5. \n
",[],"c752bb00-6483-418e-89c2-85500948dafc","🥣 Microwave Method","

Perfect for smaller amounts or if you’re tight on stove space.

\n
    \n
  1. In a large microwave-safe bowl, combine:
      \n
    • 1 cup rinsed rice
      • \n
    • 1½ cups water
      • \n
    • A pinch of salt
      • \n
    2. \n \n
  2. Cover loosely (or use a vented microwave cover).
    3. \n
  3. Microwave on HIGH for:
      \n
    • White rice: 10-12 mins
      • \n
    • Brown rice: 20-25 mins
      • \n
    4. \n \n
  4. Let sit for 5 mins, then fluff with a fork.
    5. \n
\n

Pro Tip: Use a big bowl - the water bubbles up!

",[],"f380e80d-dd29-4e5f-b732-9c72cd021ae0","🍚 Rice Cooker Method","

Set it and forget it - rice cookers do the work for you.

\n
    \n
  1. Add rinsed rice and water using the same ratios:
      \n
    • 1 cup rice : 1½ cups water (white)
      • \n
    • 1 cup rice : 2 cups water (brown)
      • \n
    2. \n \n
  2. Close the lid and hit “cook.”
    3. \n
  3. When it switches to “warm,” let it sit for 5-10 mins, then fluff.
    4. \n
\n

Pro Tip:\nAdd a bay leaf, stock cube, or whole garlic clove for extra flavour.

",[],"3a04f321-7c8e-4f91-ba83-2812eddab6a2","🍛 Leftover rice?","

Try fried rice, salad bowls, or turn it sweet with a creamy rice pudding – all of the flexible recipes you need are in ‘make’ section of the app.

",[],"1869111c-a501-42cd-a5e6-58de1d30af29","

🔥 Use a Big Pot

\n

Give your pasta room to move so it doesn’t stick together.

","8be8dd09-a0af-47d7-9911-fd32fa5225de","

💦 Water Matters

\n

Use 3–5 litres of water, depending on your pasta amount.
\nCover loosely to boil faster - but leave a gap to prevent overflow.

","8204fceb-a69c-4d43-b3a0-1ee1c3f65050","

🧂 Salt It Generously

\n

Add at least 1 tbsp salt per 5–6L water.
\nThe water should taste slightly salty - like a mild seawater.

","7f991828-a4f7-4d12-bc30-edaf57d13510","

💨 Boil It Properly

\n

Wait for a rolling boil before adding pasta - not just a few bubbles.
\nRe-cover briefly to bring it back to a boil quickly.

","404bde64-8a6b-4e80-988b-08837bdf4b65","

🍝 Stir to Prevent Clumps

\n

Stir well when first added and a few times during cooking.
\nSkip the oil - stirring does the trick!

","4239937a-2da3-4d95-b056-6e9ae5d07d63","

⏱️ Test Early & Aim for Al Dente

\n

Start checking 2 mins before the packet says.
\nPasta should be firm to the bite (al dente), not mushy.
\nToo firm? Finish it off in your sauce.

","7cea4f41-52d5-4468-a87d-9981b98a5cd8","

💧 Save That Pasta Water

\n

Reserve a mug of the starchy cooking water before draining.
\nIt’s gold for loosening thick sauces or helping them cling better.

","58a757ac-36fd-40b9-afeb-83ae4c428693","

👌 Drain & Sauce Straight Away

\n

Don’t rinse - the starch helps sauces stick.
\nToss immediately with sauce and serve hot!

","a8788bdc-cfd3-4bc5-85ef-ddb94dea2b5f","

💧 Dry & Season

\n

Pat fish dry with paper towels, then season with salt and pepper before battering. This helps the coating stick and boosts flavour.

","8f08f224-9251-45e5-a0c3-535df25bafd4","

🌡 Control the Oil Temp

\n

Too cold = soggy. Too hot = burnt outside, raw inside.
\nAim for 190°C.

\n

No thermometer? Drop in a small piece of bread - it should sizzle and turn golden in about 15 seconds. If it burns too quickly or doesn’t sizzle, your oil’s not ready.

","e7c6c92f-63a8-41c5-8c1a-7406bd0d3a95","

🍳 Don’t Overcrowd

\n

Frying too many pieces at once lowers the oil temp. Cook in small batches to keep things golden and crisp.

","39fe2f06-8ab2-4998-9a1c-e3e5ea1c9bfb","

🧺 Skip the Paper Towels

\n

After frying, place fish on a cooling rack, not paper towels. This avoids steam build-up and keeps the coating crunchy.

",[],"d9feff77-35bb-4ca0-919f-943051967bd1","👍🏼 Saveful Tips:","

",[],"ae984526-8354-490d-bfaa-cabb9b5ad070","Saveful-meal-prep-and-storage-video-image.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Saveful-meal-prep-and-storage-video-image.png","37ddeee6-60fa-42d0-86d0-1831d355d8f5","Rabobank logo","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/sponsor_logos/rabobank-logo.png","5775fcf7-aa88-42f4-812b-3b914c0b47c3","Saveful Rabobank transparent logo BW","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/sponsor_logos/Saveful-Rabobank-transparent-logo-BW.png","589b84e8-a046-435b-8e72-a6d3b818ec53","3300428b-424b-4d7b-b748-fb19fddac52a","2ebd76fe-42f7-4141-b11f-75de92cf82a7","8d1ad4b4-b946-47d7-82dc-7a72f92cc37b","a13c4c90-39b0-4bc8-aacb-457b4113487b","🥩 Thin Cuts? High Heat, Short Time","

Quick-cooking cuts like skewers, sausages and thin steaks love the heat. Sear fast, flip quickly, and don’t overdo it.

",[],"5f59ee16-4ec5-47fa-bd51-2764a7429db6","🍗 Skewer Smarts","

Soak wooden skewers in water for 20-30 mins to prevent burning.

\n

Use up what’s in your fridge - capsicum, onion, zucchini, mushrooms… skewers are the ultimate clean-out meal.

",[],"3302cdad-30b2-44cc-b9d2-3bb8261b20ae","🧂 Flavour Boosters","

Season Generously - But at the Right Time

\n

Salt meat early (40+ mins before cooking) or just before it hits the grill - no in-between!

\n

✨ Pantry spices? Turn them into a dry rub and skip the sauce.

\n

💧 Marinade Magic - got yoghurt, citrus juice, mustard or herbs? Mix up a quick marinade - even 15 minutes adds loads of flavour.

",[],"b7eb5e56-a4be-43f4-b9af-8aefb3af5b57","🌽 Grill More Than Meat","

BBQs are not just for snags:

\n
    \n
  • Corn cobs
    • \n
  • Haloumi slices
    • \n
  • Whole onions or garlic (wrapped in foil)
    • \n
  • Stone fruit like peaches or nectarines for dessert
    • \n
",[],"0f550922-0d46-4bd5-9279-4c277b7e1c59","♻️ Leftover Makeover - BBQ Once, Eat Twice","

Grill extra while you’re at it and save it for:

\n
    \n
  • Wraps or toasties
    • \n
  • Rice bowls or salads
    • \n
  • Frittatas or stir-fries
    • \n
",[],"a5fd445a-c7ef-4de9-92e8-5471a2b98de0","37851613-b9f7-4356-9919-81dfbdd42686","🧼 Clean-Up Tip","

Clean While It’s Hot

\n

Before the grill cools completely, scrub it with a halved onion or crumpled foil.

\n

Less scrubbing later, less water, and way less mess.

",[],"bad6c514-c64f-41e3-8a7a-4de03d8682b0","🛢 Oil Smart","

Oil your food, not the grill.

\n

This helps prevent flare-ups and stops things from sticking without gumming up your BBQ plates.

",[],"357d54c7-5c2e-47ea-8114-b7e260214f94","🧂 Rubs & Marinades = Flavour Boosters","

Dry rubs (using pantry spices) and quick marinades are easy ways to add layers of flavour and use up ingredients like yoghurt, citrus, mustard or leftover herbs.

\n

✨ Even 15 minutes of marinating makes a difference!

",[],"8d5d1a65-4891-4a5d-8758-c7347af2bc6d","🔥 Know Your BBQ Zones","

If your BBQ has a hotplate and a grill plate:

\n
    \n
  • Use the hotplate for lower-temp cooking or delicate foods
    • \n
  • Use the grill plate for fast, high-heat searing and those epic grill marks
    • \n
\n

Set up temperature zones:

\n
    \n
  • Sear meat on high heat, then move to a medium zone to cook through gently
    • \n
",[],"b8c5b58f-c5fe-49a1-81d5-53d37dac92c9","🧊 Bring It to Room Temp","

Take meat or chicken out of the fridge 45–60 mins before cooking.

\n

This helps it cook more evenly and sear better from the start.

",[],"68ef4b9e-4828-49be-bc1d-7002f916906a","⏱ Don’t Flip too Early","

If it’s sticking to the grill, it’s not ready to turn.

\n

Let it cook a little longer - it’ll release naturally when the surface is seared.

",[],"82af0b1e-bd8a-4b8d-8e59-f2b27897bdce","Space It Out","

Don’t overcrowd the BBQ.

\n

Give your food room to breathe so it sears - not stews or steams.

",[],"920ab91b-3350-4221-890d-df9ab67a4a70","🛌 Rest, Rest, Rest!","

Resting = juicy meat.

\n

For larger cuts, rest for 20–30 mins loosely covered with foil.

\n

Smaller cuts like steaks or chicken breasts? 5–10 mins is plenty.

",[],"29ce285a-62e5-461c-bd93-6e63e78a86bc","229bff27-0b27-4c18-86bb-a4246f313fd0","03eb21f4-4f85-4571-ba8b-65695938707f","42447b3d-24b4-4ad3-bde8-895e353871e7","f1502b12-d424-48e9-bb89-a184489e1fcb","🌶️ Garlic & Chilli Vinegar","

A punchy tang for dressings or marinades.

\n

How to: Add 2 smashed garlic cloves and 1-2 dried chillies to 1 cup white vinegar. Steep for 1 week.

",[],"33fb865f-ec41-49cc-80e2-32ecd0279c63","🍊 Citrus Herb Vinegar","

A zingy vinegar made from leftover citrus peels.

\n

How to: Add orange, lemon, or lime peels and a few basil or mint leaves to 1 cup white or apple cider vinegar. Let steep 1-2 weeks.

",[],"2b7f82c9-ae5e-4e2a-aabd-61df3d00d754","🧅 Shallot & Mustard Seed Vinegar","

Perfect in vinaigrettes or over roasted root veg.

\n

How to: Combine 1 finely sliced shallot, 1 tsp mustard seeds, and 1 cup red wine vinegar. Let steep 5-7 days.

",[],"9311160e-46f2-4a2b-bffc-b99f960b9172","🌿 Rosemary Infused Olive Oil","

Gorgeous on roast potatoes or for dipping crusty bread.

\n

How to: Simmer 1 cup olive oil with 2-3 rosemary sprigs over low heat for 5-10 mins. Cool, strain, store.

",[],"71e26742-a578-4203-bd3e-fe5486d3989d","🍋 Lemon & Thyme Oil","

Bright and herby - perfect over fish, greens, or pasta.

\n

How to: Heat 1 cup olive oil with a few strips of lemon peel and 3-4 thyme sprigs. Simmer gently, cool, strain.

",[],"338ba001-01a0-44a4-b38e-dd00c7f64aef","🧄 Smoky Paprika & Garlic Oil","

Add smoky depth to roast veg, eggs, or grilled meats.

\n

How to: Simmer 1 cup olive oil with 1 tsp smoked paprika and 1 crushed garlic clove. Cool, strain, and enjoy.

",[],"836cfe9f-51a4-4d82-a104-afabae6df5a9","🌱 Basil & Black Pepper Oil","

Great for pasta, pizza, or summer salads.

\n

How to: Heat 1 cup olive oil with ½ cup fresh basil leaves and 1 tsp cracked black pepper. Let sit, strain, and bottle.

",[],"55c3e78b-d4fa-4bc4-a1cd-18b8c008d993","🔥 For High-Heat Cooking (frying, roasting, barbecuing)","

Look for oils with a high smoke point – they’re more stable at high temps and won’t burn or go bitter.

\n

Best picks:

\n
    \n
  • Canola oil
    • \n
  • Sunflower oil
    • \n
  • Vegetable oil
    • \n
  • Peanut oil
    • \n
\n

Budget-friendly and perfect for frying, searing and roasting.

",[],"762bb383-28f6-4de0-810b-5fed0eb072d0","🍳 For Medium-Heat Cooking (sautéing, baking)","

You’ve got a little more flexibility here.

\n

Best picks:

\n
    \n
  • Olive oil (regular/light)
    • \n
  • Rice bran oil
    • \n
  • Avocado oil
",[],"80439416-3c91-46e4-a4d0-eb4ccd5693e6","🥗 For Dressings, Dips & Drizzling","

Use your flavour-packed oils here - they’ll really shine.

\n

Best picks:

\n
    \n
  • Extra virgin olive oil
    • \n
  • Sesame oil (toasted)
    • \n
  • Walnut or flaxseed oil (keep these in the fridge)
    • \n
\n

💡 Save the good stuff for where you’ll actually taste it!

",[],"cfef6a38-db3a-426a-87ed-d18fdb68d05c","54d6ac68-2b50-456c-91b2-a67bc59a6289","

🧑‍🍳 Set Up Your Prep Station

\n

Don’t wait! Chop straight after your shop.

\n

Set up your cutting board, containers, and compost bin - maybe even throw on a podcast or get the family involved. You’ll thank yourself later when your veggies are ready to grab and go.

","7e5bdcf4-4be2-4452-9ce7-69b827d26346","

📋 Check Your Weekly Meals

\n

Glance over your planned meals and prep accordingly:

\n
    \n
  • Snacks: Chop carrots, celery, or capsicum into sticks.
    • \n
  • Meals: Dice, slice or grate veggies based on recipe needs.
    • \n
\n

💡 Tip: Store cut veggies in airtight containers (add a splash of water to keep them crisp). Prepping ahead helps you use what you’ve got — and avoid last-minute takeaway.

","71d14d13-c637-4b24-b6e9-e2f37c2a3998","

⚡ Take Smart Shortcuts

\n

Batch your basics and breeze through the week:

\n
    \n
  • 🍋 Juice lemons ahead and store in a jar
    • \n
  • 🧅 Chop onions in one go (store in small containers to avoid daily tears)
    • \n
  • 🧄 Grate garlic & ginger and store in jars
    • \n
  • 🥛 Make extra nut or seed milk and freeze portions
    • \n
  • 🌿 Pre-mix your fave spice blends for easy flavour boosts
    • \n
","7e041f73-c447-4272-a84e-2a6d5d1383a3","

❄️ Freeze What You Don’t Use

\n

Bought more than you need? Freeze the extras!

\n
    \n
  • Chop and freeze leftover veg (like broccoli or capsicum)
    • \n
  • Save scraps (peels, stems) for homemade veggie stock
    • \n
  • Blanch and freeze leafy greens for soups and stir-fries
    • \n
  • Cook double batches of meals and freeze half for later
    • \n
","a0fef62b-ffa3-4ac6-8e9b-f4374801c79c","23447c99-ba9b-466e-917d-c82e6d691a53","🌿 Mint Tea","

Perfect for digestion or cooling down on a hot day.

\n

You’ll need:

  • 2–3 fresh mint leaves (or 1 tsp dried mint)
  • Hot water
  • Optional: honey, sugar, lemon slices
\n

\n

How to:

\n
  • Steep mint in hot water for 5 minutes.
  • Sweeten and add lemon if you like.
  • Serve hot or chill for a refreshing iced tea.
\n

",[],"6ca37df9-ddfc-4a75-ae20-23c21bc69461","☕ Spiced Chai Tea","

Cosy, comforting, and better than store-bought.

\n

You’ll need:

\n
  • 1 tsp ground cinnamon
  • 1 tsp cardamom pods
  • 1 clove
  • 1 tsp ginger powder
  • 1–2 tsp black tea leaves or a chai tea bag
  • 2 cups water
  • Optional: honey or sugar, splash of milk
\n

How to:

\n
  • Simmer spices in water for 10 mins
  • Then add tea and simmer 5 more.
  • Strain, sweeten, and enjoy.
",[],"79614b6f-4123-4d59-9de2-8348f92738b0","🌼 Chamomile & Lemon Balm","

Soothing and perfect before bed.

\n

Steep 1 tsp dried or 2–3 fresh lemon balm leaves with chamomile flowers or a chamomile tea bag.

",[],"f26f3e68-2643-4379-bdc9-6a24d1b0bc59","🧡 Turmeric Ginger Tea","

Anti-inflammatory and warming.

\n
  • Simmer 1 tsp ground turmeric
  • + 1 tsp grated ginger in 2 cups of water for 10 minutes.
  • Add black pepper to boost the benefits!
",[],"67b9ef28-27b6-46a6-b472-e657e1a6d359","🍏 Apple & Cinnamon Peel Tea","

Use leftover apple peels and a cinnamon stick.

\n

Simmer gently for 10–15 mins for a sweet, spiced cup.

",[],"b4b52322-f596-4357-bb6b-07bf0a99affe","Middle Eastern Rub:","

Use this on pork ribs, grilled veggies, or tofu for a smoky, sweet kick.

",[],"bdc5f4ef-1aa3-4b08-bf2e-00180747374d","Saveful-Herby-Butters-video-image.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Saveful-Herby-Butters-video-image.png","ae129460-0030-415f-b7a2-6704d71f4e2f","Saveful-DIY-Trail-Mix-video-image.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Saveful-DIY-Trail-Mix-video-image.png","7041f03c-469f-4f61-ab25-efc6f2410cdb","37ae5654-7621-4a3b-bb0c-b772c17ad033","Saveful-rustic-veggie-chip-video-image.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Saveful-rustic-veggie-chip-video-image.png","41ab2263-22d2-4b4a-b3db-a79dcfeba30b","Oven-Method-hack-icon.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Oven-Method-hack-icon.png","71ee25ce-da15-4ae2-928c-fd5f7b160276","Air-Fryer-hack-icon.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Air-Fryer-hack-icon.png","0b61a01e-c922-4d23-8f83-de5be9be600e","663b753d-a12d-4357-a6e0-5d096b738656","Saveful-Going-Crackers-video-image.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Saveful-Going-Crackers-video-image.png","0b8ec6b4-1da3-4b51-863b-e61350218cb5","Saveful-Pickle-me-Tender-video-image.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Saveful-Pickle-me-Tender-video-image.png","3d19b8f3-eb3d-4cf6-b826-fca4a8c1cf5d","

Prep those jars

\n

First, prep your jars – use jars with a screwtop lid. Run the jars and lids through the dishwasher, or wash them in hot soapy water. Rinse well and dry thoroughly.

","3fe5e788-4b41-4b43-8db5-21c3e261d6ab","

Ready your veg

\n

Next up, prep your veg and pack into your jars, leaving about 1.5cm at the top

","bbd3de55-fd24-4b02-ae94-cb85f584f22c","

Brine time!!

\n

Combine equal quantities of vinegar and water in a saucepan and season with salt. You can use apple cider vinegar, white vinegar, white wine vinegar, red wine vinegar, sherry vinegar, rice vinegar, brown rice vinegar – all work well. 

\n

(Hot tip: avoid aged or concentrated vinegars like malt or balsamic for pickling, as their flavour is too intense).

\n

Add a little sugar or sweetener (like honey or agave syrup) too, to mellow out the vinegar, if you like. Bring it to the boil, then remove from the heat.

","aece9b07-a9e2-415c-88ce-de9e95ac18b1","

Add some aromatics

\n

You can add extra flavour with herbs or spices too, if you like. Some aromatics we like to use are things like bruised whole garlic cloves, bay leaves, thyme sprigs, rosemary sprigs, chilli flakes, dill sprigs, caraway seeds, fennel seeds, mustard seeds, peppercorns, coriander seeds, cumin seeds. 

\n

Scratch around your fridge or pantry to see what you can add. It’s just as yummy plain and simple, too, though!

","7856b229-ef7b-497f-96e4-195e69a47611","

Pour the hot brine over your veggies

\n

Go ahead and fill up the jars. You want to leave 1cm below the rims of the jars. Give them a tap to get all the air bubbles out and make sure your veg are fully covered.

","3922170f-fce6-46fb-9105-624c15c58cd4","

Wait for 48 hours!

\n

Seal, cool to room temperature then refrigerate for 48 hours to develop the flavours. They get better with age! 

\n

Your quick pickles will keep refrigerated for up to 2 months.

","717d712a-d63a-42eb-bbf6-45728b1ac1ec","4607eb12-a52b-4ffd-a36b-452d0a64c2d7","Saveful-Easy-peasy-jams-video-image.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Saveful-Easy-peasy-jams-video-image.png","e5aaf805-2343-4085-a06d-fbc1aa01b8d8","12-Minute Berry & Herb Jam - Quick stovetop jam using fresh or frozen berries.","

You’ll need:

\n
  • 3 cups berries (any kind)
  • 1 cup honey or sugar
  • 5 - 6 sprigs fresh herbs (thyme, rosemary or basil)
  • Juice of ½ lemon or lime
\n

How to:

\n

Chop berries and mix with honey and herbs. Let sit until juicy, then simmer for 8 -12 minutes until thick and sticky. Spoon into jars. To store long term, water-bath jars for 10 mins.

\n

\n📦 Lasts 1 year (sealed), or 3 - 4 weeks in the fridge.

",[],"b18a0727-8c26-4550-9db8-a187e9274ee3","No-Cook Chia Jam - No heat. Just stir, soak and mash.","

You’ll need:

\n
  • 5 cups frozen berries
  • ¼ cup chia seeds
  • 2 tbsp orange juice
  • 3-4 tbsp maple syrup or honey (optional)
\n

How to:

\n

Mix everything in a bowl and let thaw for 3 hours or overnight in the fridge. Mash, taste, and sweeten if needed. Let sit 20 mins to thicken.

\n

\n🧊 Store in the fridge for 5 days.

\n

Perfect on toast, pancakes, yogurt, granola, or stirred into chia pudding.

",[],"9f916dce-a46a-4507-b83e-3ac2e26293f2","Pantry Dried Fruit Jam - For when your fresh fruit bowl is bare.","

You’ll need:

\n
  • 600g dried fruit (apricots, dates, apples, etc.)
  • 400ml boiling water
  • 300g sugar
  • Juice & zest of ½ lemon
\n

How to:

\n

Soak fruit in boiling water overnight. Drain (save the water), then blitz in a food processor. Add sugar, lemon and soaking liquid to a saucepan. Heat gently to dissolve sugar, then boil rapidly until thick and glossy (105°C). Spoon into jars.

\n

🫙 Keeps up to 4 months in a cool, dark spot.

",[],"0ba5faff-a07a-462f-b141-5775bbfef580","b879c954-60fc-42f4-8333-fac60b6f1871","Saveful Bakers Delight transparent logo","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/sponsor_logos/Saveful-Bakers-Delight-transparent-logo.png","f14eb486-8866-46d0-8a25-f8a541b6af20","Saveful Bakers Delight transparent logo BW","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/sponsor_logos/Saveful-Bakers-Delight-transparent-logo-BW.png","734bc1ea-42ee-45bb-bdaf-ff74cf58fd6c","Saveful-pantry-detox-hack-image-hero_2025-06-06-003202_qtsv.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Saveful-pantry-detox-hack-image-hero_2025-06-06-003202_qtsv.png","ec9d197d-df56-44bf-957b-0280bd6d2d90","

Empty it all out - 

\n

Yup, everything. It’s the only way to truly see what’s been hiding at the back. (Hello, mystery can from 2020).

","1d048d7d-b4e4-473a-9631-ff448204c4d9","

Check the dates - 

\n

Look for anything past its best or showing signs of spoilage (weird smells, dodgy packaging). If it’s still good but nearing expiry, move it to the front and plan to use it soon.

","3bf2ccdf-e307-44ac-8b08-5cfec82b3125","

Double ups & extras - 

\n

Found 5 bags of lentils? No judgment. Group similar items together and make a plan to use up your extras. Unopened, in-date items you won’t use? Consider donating them.

","f0896f68-f4c9-4ddd-a507-1fd37a8c362b","

Make a 'Use Me First' shelf - 

\n

Create a spot for anything that needs to be used soon. It’s your go-to for planning meals and saving food before it gets forgotten again.

","b737861b-f2d1-4c45-9284-054369d15a37","

Sort it out - 

\n

Group things in a way that works for you - grains, tins, snacks, baking bits, spices. Clear containers can help you see what you’ve got and avoid those sneaky double buys.

","5418188e-cdc1-49a1-9c70-826121427c31","

Spice check - 

\n

Spices don’t last forever (even if they pretend to). Give them a sniff or taste - if they’re more ‘meh’ than ‘wow’, it might be time to say goodbye and restock in smaller amounts.

","1e4afa67-133c-4243-945f-b0c5a44cf332","

Label like a legend - 

\n

Label jars and containers with what’s inside and when you bought it. It’s a simple step that makes a big difference.

","95c5790c-fc59-4b5c-9d76-ae6455043887","

Wipe, line, and shine - 

\n

Before popping everything back, give your pantry a good clean. Line shelves if you like, and check for any pests. Fresh space, fresh start!

","569e14db-4ce9-44cf-89d9-dde47ca73a77","Saveful Gumtree transparent logo","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/sponsor_logos/Saveful-Gumtree-transparent-logo.png","cded99d2-f832-4e60-ab30-ac2bd4576d52","Saveful Gumtree transparent logo BW","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/sponsor_logos/Saveful-Gumtree-transparent-logo-BW.png","aaaf2bf0-f7f2-4049-aed1-9f5f2fbddda1","14be6cfb-4173-45f3-add4-fd34a48735a7","db41bfcc-8d36-4e9b-8b80-b34e35f67bf7","eb644b88-6776-4e7e-95a7-10b37dbb98cd","Saveful AGL transparent logo","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/sponsor_logos/Saveful-AGL-transparent-logo_2025-05-14-023153_pnqx.png","221c7559-62eb-410e-a163-632796361718","Saveful AGL transparent logo BW","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/sponsor_logos/Saveful-AGL-transparent-logo-BW_2025-05-14-023209_xswz.png","8616402e-fdaa-442a-b081-bfadffd8d9fc","036c0bb3-7513-4328-b440-80359d7d41be","5de46261-6a3f-4276-b3cd-fd1bb41787a7","68471ec5-8bfc-46c2-b68a-9da5f458729b","6131aff8-28d5-4959-943d-9f6516527401","Stock-VideoThumb-1.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Stock-VideoThumb-1.png","e70c0289-58b3-48f7-82dc-795bd5badc2f","

Collect your veggie scraps as you go and add them to a zip-lock bag in the freezer.

","287bf02b-76c5-4b3e-b458-4fcec1b58761","

You can re-use your zip-lock bags between stocks – just give them a good rinse with warm water and let them dry completely before re-using.

","93d202ad-bcd7-419a-a7a7-f3f9d691785a","

Veggie scraps will give a lighter-flavoured stock. Use chunks of veggies if you want a heartier stock.

","56bcc6c4-d3e7-49ba-9323-e331d1e49552","

You can use up bones and parmesan rind in your stocks, too. Keep any bones in a separate zip-lock bag.

","1654b3bf-ff26-4b79-806a-cd0325941244","

Add dried mushrooms for an umami (a deep, savoury flavour) bomb!

","aea2b8c8-5076-4f8e-845d-4371342d3eed","Pantry-VideoThumb_2023-12-20-001539_bira.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Pantry-VideoThumb_2023-12-20-001539_bira.png","6de4172d-ce2c-4ab4-9ba3-8b7d05097422","Pantry-Salt.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Pantry-Salt.png","57b2286c-be91-4c35-be67-d00d85a3e3b5","Pantry-Acid.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Pantry-Acid.png","25494d3d-f8b7-4bd6-b457-9d8f105825cc","Pantry-Fat.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Pantry-Fat.png","68c5b8ea-4d1c-4166-8b64-98b02d99a59b","c4af7ba6-d13d-437b-91b7-a02f8ea33b89","Pantry-Aromatics.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Pantry-Aromatics.png","4e9e60cf-181b-4978-87e8-3bc06c06946a","Pantry-Carbs.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Pantry-Carbs.png","a37f2e45-5489-4c08-a52a-92b82d49a6b6","Pantry-Umami.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Pantry-Umami.png","9c2ca385-a2af-45ca-902e-d5809c1b42e2","Pantry-Fridge.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Pantry-Fridge.png","a6abe9be-e32a-48a8-bc42-f2f8a002a97f","8a4dce68-4078-4dbf-b9ce-015a47924e91","FlavourWorlds-Oil.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/FlavourWorlds-Oil.png","ee242c7b-1d0c-4dfe-b8f3-900e0d458b0c","FlavourWorlds-Acid.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/FlavourWorlds-Acid.png","cff6b8e9-e387-4a77-952b-02f108b6e9fa","FlavourWorlds-Pantry.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/FlavourWorlds-Pantry.png","1be250ce-1acd-4aa0-96be-1692bec96d90","FlavourWorlds-Aromatics.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/FlavourWorlds-Aromatics.png","9dc1f83c-8167-440d-8f49-3a11d448682d","Pantry-Herbs.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/Pantry-Herbs.png","a1a62a92-0fbe-4a22-9004-a3064b4e6afe","FlavourWorlds-Spice.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/FlavourWorlds-Spice.png","dd8fcde9-03bf-42cb-ad5c-b13e19518789","47a9562d-ac41-413e-a0a0-9594e14297ac","FlavourWorlds-Veg.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/FlavourWorlds-Veg.png","3980517d-252f-4823-a3f5-65db9bac4534","FlavourWorlds-Carbs.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/FlavourWorlds-Carbs.png","c6cfacc7-05a9-49b9-b070-9821bd9f3b0e","FlavourWorlds-Protein.png","https://saveful-cms-dev.s3.amazonaws.com/FlavourWorlds-Protein.png","b9c1063c-79ae-4a4a-b573-bcb95da24890","bb1cbff0-5a70-4401-bb7a-1e12c80ffc83","eb4e568c-ca2c-4c2d-8fd7-509a45284966","137cda44-2599-4398-90c7-7d082c46e5aa","139ab633-d29d-49be-9b7c-6a56d2d1e7ca"]
